threat: A local attacker could use this flaw to mount to arbitrary locations, leading to privilege escalation.
A local attacker could use this flaw to unmount to arbitrary locations, leading to a denial of service.
A local attacker could use this flaw to mount an arbitrary directory, possibly leading to information disclosure.
A local attacker could use this flaw to corrupt the mtab file, and possibly unmount arbitrary locations, leading to a denial of service.
A local attacker could use this flaw to manipulate keys during creation of a new user.
A local attacker could use this flaw to possibly access another user's data during the recovery process.
A local attacker could use this flaw to possibly overwrite arbitrary files.
special:
The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:
In general, a standard system update will make all the necessary changes.
